Attention First and Second Years!
This is the Group division of the Phase-2 workshop. Please reach the given venue by 2pm on December 9th, 2017. 
Autonomous Group-1: F244, Main building
Autonomous Group-2: F236, Main building
IP: F235, Main building.

All the people attending the IP workshop try to dual boot your laptops with Ubuntu 16.04 before coming to save essential time and efforts.
Also, everyone kindly bring a flash drive for both autonomous and IP workshops.

Technology Robotix Society looks forward to providing the best learning experience. Good luck!

https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1hIvZAClipDhk53YAa8GkC0xxS3PPgTPeRkZ1hHkyztc/edit?usp=sharing

message:
Making a robot is the first step towards mimicking God.

The annual Kolkata workshop concluded on November 5th, 2017, with an excellent note and a great zeal and turn-up from students across many engineering colleges. Technology Robotix Society, IIT Kharagpur, in association with Kshitij, IIT Kharagpur conducted a two-hour seminar in Kolkata to acquaint students from different technical institutes within the city with the problem statements and events that are to be held this year at the grandest Techno-management fest this nation witnesses. Kshitij. 

The opening note of this seminar was an airy one, with our beloved Albatross hovering in mid-air over the audience, who enjoyed it a lot. Followed the series of bot demonstrations of the Problem statements for this year’s events. Namely: Poles Apart, the manual event, Stax, the autonomous event and Fortress, the Image Processing event.

The objective of this workshop was to pull out to the limelight the fact that making a robot is not as difficult as people think it is. In fact, there are a lot of possible innovations that one can figure out and make the best out of it if given an opportunity like the robotics events at Kshitij. This was well pointed out by making a few classic and simple robots by the members of Technology Robotix Society. Like a gesture control bot, that is literally controlled by your fingertips. A stair-climbing robot demonstrating the importance of a mechanical design in making a useful bot, and finally a fully autonomous robot that can find it’s way out of a corridor using only sonars. 

The workshop ended with the official release of the events that are to be held this year at Kshitij, along with the demonstration of a working prototype for each event. This was done to point out the fact that the events that we have set up for everyone to learn and have fun with are not only feasible but can prove to be a step in a direction that might take you to place, you never thought of.

Referring this workshop to a huge success will not be completely right, if not wrong because the real measure of success will be the participation and the enthusiasm which Kshitij will witness this year. Technology Robotics Society wishes that everyone fulfils our purpose of all the hard work that goes into making these events possible, that is, spreading the culture of robotics far and wide so that what we do can make a substantial impact on the society positively.

Hoping for a great participation and enthusiasm, we wish you good luck!
story: Technology Robotix Society added 8 new photos.

Due to overwhelming response and a lot of requests,we have extended the  deadline to apply as an RSE to 10th December, 2017, 11:55 PM. This is your last chance to apply, don't miss it!
RSEs will be our point of contact with the particular college and will aid communication and interaction to encourage robotics activities there. All RSEs receive a certificate from Team Robotix, as well as exclusive Robotix merchandise, certification from Technology Robotix Society, constant contact with robotics experts for any kind of help and advice on robotics, and the tag itself.
If you are passionate about robotics and want your college to shine at Robotix 2018, all that you have to do is fill up an online form.
Click: www.robotix.in/rse/ to be one of the Robotix Student Executives.

Vraj Parikh shared a post to Technology Robotix Society's Timeline. Attention first and second years! Registrations for those selected for the first phase of the Winter Workshop will be taking place on 30th November for both Autonomous and Image Processing. People can come in either of the time slots to the Robotix Lakeside Lab, Gymkhana.

Hey everyone,
Here's the final list of all those who have been selected for the Winter Workshop. 
Note that all second years have NOT been selected, as there was a minimum requirement for each section for them to be eligible. 
We have tried to accommodate all students as per their preferences, and now no more requests to change them will be entertained.

Robotix Student Executives (RSEs) are our point of contact with the particular college and will aid communication and interaction to encourage robotics activities there. All RSEs receive a certificate from Team Robotix, as well as exclusive Robotix merchandise, certification from Technology Robotix Society, constant contact with robotics experts for any kind of help and advice on robotics, and the tag itself.

Want to become an RSE but haven't filled the form yet? Don't worry, there is still time!

Click: www.robotix.in/rse/ to be one of the Robotix Student Executives.

The deadline for the application is 20th November, 23:59 hrs.

All RSEs receive a certificate from Team Robotix, as well as exclusive Robotix merchandise, certification from Technology Robotix Society, constant contact with robotics experts for any kind of help and advice on robotics, and the tag itself.

Want to become an RSE but haven't filled the form yet? Don't worry, there is still time!

Click: www.robotix.in/rse/ to be one of the Robotix Student Executives.

The deadline for the application is 20th November, 23:59 hrs.

Imagine designing a robot capable of changing it's interaxial distance to suit the kind of terrain that it traverses. The mechanical event in Robotix 2018, Poles Apart will give you that opportunity. This is your chance to create a paper design for the event.
If your design wins, you'll get a direct entry into the second round of the event at Robotix 2018, where a lot of exciting prizes await you. 

Further details can be found at 
www.robotix.in/mechdesign
To read more about Poles Apart visit
https://www.robotix.in/event/poles-apart/

The final date for submissions is 30th November, 2017.

message:
It’s time once again for the Annual Kolkata workshop organised by Technology Robotix Society in collaboration with Kshitij, IIT Kharagpur.
You will witness the live demonstrations of some fascinating robots. A comprehensive introduction on the fundamentals of autonomous robotics and image processing will be presented.  An unveiling of the events for Robotix 2018 will also be done so don't miss this chance. This year promises to be as exciting as ever and would leave you all astonished with the magnificence of robotics. We hope to see all of you there!
Date: 10:00AM
Time: 05-11-2017
Veunu: G.D. Birla Sabhagar
story: Technology Robotix Society added an event.

Due to the recent mishaps and an open house session with the director today, the Winter Workshop test has been called off for both first and second years.
The inconvenience is deeply regretted and Technology Robotix Society urges everyone to participate in the open house session today at 7. 

The dates for the test will be announced very soon. Stay updated.

Here is a glimpse of an Autonomous Step Counter and Heading Following Robot from Winter Workshop 2015. The robot could autonomously count the number of steps taken by a person and move in the same direction as the person by an equivalent distance. Want to make a robot like this one and the winters to be productive? Attend the Winter Workshop for this year!
Registration forms will be out soon.

Hey Freshers!

Here's the component list for the Hardware Hackathon for Line Following Robot to be held on Sunday. Do get the components at the earliest from Chaudhari's in Tech Market!

1. IC7805 Voltage Regulator - 1
2. L293D Motor Driver - 1
3. IR Module - 2
4. 300-500rpm DC Motor - 2
5. Battery 9v-12v - 1
6. PCB - 1
7. Chasis - 1
8. Castor wheel - 1
9. Wheels - 2
10. Battery connector - 1
11. Solder iron - 1
12. Solder wire - 1
13. IC Bed for L293D - 1
14. Jumpers (male to female) - 6

Hey, 1st and 2nd years! 

Technology Robotix Society conducts an IEEE certified Winter Workshop every year for 1st and 2nd years interested in learning more advanced concepts of robotics, namely Autonomous Robotics and Image Processing. The workshop is conducted in two phases, the first one is for students who aren't attending EAA camps in the first week of December and the second one is for those who are.

Attendance in KRAIG classes is not compulsory to attend the Winter Workshop but is recommended.

We are releasing the tentative dates of the workshop so that the interested students may book their tickets in advance.

Phase 1: 1st December to 7th December
Phase 2: 9th December to 15th December

Hey, 1st and 2nd years! 

Technology Robotix Society conducts an IEEE certified Winter Workshop every year for 1st and 2nd years interested in learning more advanced concepts of robotics, namely Autonomous Robotics and Image Processing. The workshop is conducted in two phases, the first one is for students who aren't attending EAA camps in the first week of December and the second one is for those who are.

Attendance in KRAIG classes is not compulsory to attend the Winter Workshop but is recommended.

We are releasing the tentative dates of the workshop so that the interested students may book their tickets in advance.

Phase 1: 1st December to 7th December
Phase 2: 9th December to 15th December

Hey, 1st and 2nd years! 

Technology Robotix Society conducts an IEEE certified Winter Workshop every year for 1st and 2nd years interested in learning more advanced concepts of robotics, namely Autonomous Robotics and Image Processing. The workshop is conducted in two phases, the first one is for students who aren't attending EAA camps in the first week of December and the second one is for those who are.

Attendance in KRAIG classes is not compulsory to attend the Winter Workshop but is recommended.

We are releasing the tentative dates of the workshop so that the interested students may book their tickets in advance.

Phase 1: 2nd December to 8th December
Phase 2: 10th December to 16th December

The results of the Robosoccer challenge held last weekend are as follows:

First place: Equipo One, with team members:
Jeevankur Talukdar, Kaustav Mandal, Apoorve Singhal

Second Place: Robo Soc, with the team members:
Suyash Karn, Varanasi Sai Shubhankar, Anand Kumar.

Third place: MMM Chargers, with team members:
Manthan Patel, Raj Gupta, Nikhil Madame.

Team Robotix congratulates all the winners. And Kudos to all those who participated. Cheers!

If you haven't made your bot yet, don't worry! We've got your back. Bring your components to our Hands-on Session and we'll make sure your bot works.

Hope to see you all there. Cheers!

If you haven't made your bot yet, don't worry! We've got your back. Bring your components to our Hands-on Session and we'll make sure your bot works.

Hope to see you all there. Cheers!

Date: 10:00AM
Time: 27-08-2017
Veunu: Technology Robotix Society

message:
Come and make your very own robot. We will ensure that your motor gushes and make you fall in love with this world of robotics.

Venue: V2
Timings: 6pm- 8pm.

PS: Get all the components from the list given earlier.

Hope to see you there. Cheers!

Attention Freshers!
Due to some unforeseen circumstances, the venue for K.R.A.I.G. 102 has been shifted to S-301 (Engineering Drawing room). We regret the inconvenience caused. 

Hope to see you there!

Attention Freshers!
Due to some unforeseen circumstances, the venue for K.R.A.I.G. 102 has been shifted to S-301 (Engineering Drawing room). We regret the inconvenience caused. 

Hope to see you there!

Hope you all enjoyed the first workshop of KRAIG 101. We were very excited to see a lot of people turn up. The journey to making a robot has just begun and with your enthusiasm, it can go a long way. See you at KRAIG 102 where we will teach about more concepts in the Manual Robotics so that you can make a working bot and get your adrenaline rush pumped up. You will be put to test when each of your bots compete against your friends in the ultimate Freshers' Robosoccer competition.
